DBRaportLatex

Class DBHandle

  • java.lang.Object
    • DBRaportLatex.DBHandle

  • public class DBHandle
extends java.lang.Object
    Class responsible for connection and executing queries on database One object represent one connection, Connection is enstablished in the constructor and if it fails you need new object Its bad coded but it works:)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DBHandle(java.lang.String enginee, java.lang.String host, java.lang.String prt, java.lang.String dbpathh, java.lang.String enc, java.lang.String u, java.lang.String pw)
      Only one constructor with many params to enstablish connection to database if it fails function is ok will return 1 and you will need to create new object or stop your program.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DBHandle

        public DBHandle(java.lang.String enginee,
                java.lang.String host,
                java.lang.String prt,
                java.lang.String dbpathh,
                java.lang.String enc,
                java.lang.String u,
                java.lang.String pw)
        Only one constructor with many params to enstablish connection to database if it fails function is ok will return 1 and you will need to create new object or stop your program. It has multiple params but it depends on engine if all params are used or only some of them. At the moment implemented are connections to engines: firebird, mysql, sqlite
        Parameters:
        enginee - name of database engine eg. firebirdsql, mysql
        host - hostname or IPv4 of database server (not used in sqlite)
        prt - port of database server connection
        dbpathh - path to database or database name
        enc - encoding of database
        u - user
        pw - password

    • Method Detail

      • isok

        public int isok()
        Check if object is constructed without problems. 0 - no errors 1 - critical error
        Returns:
        0 - no errors

      • executeSQL2

        public RecordSet executeSQL2(java.lang.String SQL)
        Basic method to query data from database if connection is on
        Parameters:
        SQL - query to database
        Returns:
        object RecorSet which contains all records returned from query

      • getErrorCount

        public int getErrorCount()
        Method returning sql query errors count
        Returns:
        error count
